section.name: Standard directory structure
section.p: The community has files for configuration, for the database of users, for its certificate authority and for user credentals. All these files are kept outside the Tomcat directory tree in order that they survive reinstallations of Tomcat and the community web-application.
They should all be owned by root.
The db sub-directory is where the community keeps its database files, both the configuration files which you will install and the actual data files.
The pem directory is where the community keeps user-credentials generated by its certificate authority (PEM stands for Privacy Enhanced Mail and is the type of credential file to be stored here).

The ca directory is where the community keeps the root credentials of its certificate authority (CA). You will later install these credentials. There will be three files: the CA's private key, the CA's root certificate and the a file recording the last serial-number used in a certificate.
All the information in these directories is important for operation of the community. You should make sure that they are all backed up.
